4764.storyline: On the 4 September 2013 episode of The Late Late Show with Craig Ferguson (2005), Elijah Wood said that he was five years old when he watched his first horror movie - Truth or Dare?: A Critical Madness (1986), which was a then-newly released. He said that it was what made him fall in love with horror films, that it remains one his all-time favorite horror movies, and that he has introduced it to several of his friends over the years.

4765.name: The Last Shark
4765.storyline: Shortly before the film's release, "Universal Pictures" sued the producers, claiming it plagiarized "Jaws (1975)," and the Australian distributors, for breach of copyright regarding Peter Benchley's book "Jaws." "Universal" won an injunction, and the film was pulled from theaters.

4766.name: Demon
4766.storyline: Director Marcin Wrona committed suicide in his hotel room on September 19, 2015, during Gdynia Polish Film Festival, where Demon (2015) was shown in competition.

4767.name: At Midnight I'll Take Your Soul
4767.storyline: The crew refused to shoot a scene because there wasn't enough sunlight. Director José Mojica Marins forced them to shoot the scene by pointing a gun at the cameraman. Various crew members have confirmed the story. On one of the rare occasions when he would respond to questions about the incident, Marins claimed that the gun was only a prop.

4768.name: Alive
4768.storyline: Marketed as a Saw film in Russia, where it's a common practice to retitle the movies by connecting them to a widely known franchises even if they have very little in common.

4769.name: Mercy Falls
4769.storyline: The cave at the end of the film has been on screen before in Monty Python and the Holy Grail.

4770.name: Three Blind Mice
4770.storyline: Three Blind Micewritten by Thomas Ravenscroftperformed by Kenneth B, Dahlia Frampton & Sebastian George-Khan

4771.name: Darna Mana Hai
4771.storyline: Nana Patekar's and Vivek Oberoi story was borrowed from the popular TV show MTV Bakra hosted by Cyrus Broacha.

4772.name: It's Alive III: Island of the Alive
4772.storyline: Both this film and A Return to Salem's Lot (1987) were intended to be released direct to home video, but they were given a limited theatrical release first.

4773.name: Suicide for Beginners
4773.storyline: Sid Haigs' final film before his passing.

4774.name: Whistle and I'll Come to You
4774.storyline: Sophie Thompson, a great actress, is the sister of Oscar winner Emma Thompson.

4776.name: Lumberjack Man
4776.storyline: Director's Lloyd Kauffman of Toxic Avenger fame, and James Gunn of Marvel Studios and DC fame both attended the premiere of this film in Austin, Texas.

4777.name: Black Spines
4777.storyline: Premiered at the Telluride Horror Fest in Colorado on October 2024

4778.name: The Amazing Mr. X
4778.storyline: Carole Landis was originally scheduled to play the part taken by Lynn Bari, but she committed suicide a few days before shooting began.

4779.name: I Piss on Your Corpse
4779.storyline: The title may be something that sounds familiar. And the cover too - not that it has much to do with the movie or anything. Or the movie it was based on (the title and the cover that is, because story wise ... well there is not much to cover anyway - no pun intended) - the movie is crazy. And has some people in it I personally know.The movie is therefor worse than the sum of its parts. It knows it is not a masterpiece, it knows it is or rather tries to be close to Ed Wood. The acting is miserable at best though. You realize that to act like you can't act ... you have to be able to act. And that ability is lacking in many participants here.Again you have to take everything with a grain of salt - actually with a whole sack of salt. Maybe a ton of it? Ok kidding aside (or am I?), the movie is as low as it goes. There are some nicer things, like the throwback blood - the 70s called and ... I don't think they want it back - they probably even offered that completely fake blood - a nod I assume to that era. There is also some nudity - and there is a bow and arrow woman who is criminally underrepresented in the movie - no pun intended.There are some outtakes during the credits that won't make or break your experience ... if you even made it that far. Yes I am crazy - but you probably know that by now.

4780.name: It Conquered the World
4780.storyline: When leading lady Beverly Garland got her first look at the titular monster, her sarcastic remark was, "THAT conquered the world?"

4781.name: Nun in Rope Hell
4781.storyline: This nunsploitationer delivers on all fronts. Lesbian nuns? Check! Sexual violence? Check! Rope bondage? Check! Of course it would, since it's based on a novel by smutmeister Dan Oniroku. All that and some nice coastal scenery as well, would love to know where it was filmed. While it doesn't rise to the heights of "School of the Holy Beast", it's definitely worth checking out for pink fans.

4782.name: The Witch Who Came from the Sea
4782.storyline: George "Buck" Flower not only acts in this movie as one of the homicide detectives investigating the murders committed by Millie Perkins, but also served as the film's casting director. In fact, Flower cast his own daughter Verkina to play young Molly in the disturbing flashback sequences featured in the movie.

4783.name: The Curse of King Tut's Tomb
4783.storyline: Jonathan Hyde (Morgan Sinclair) later described the film as "an absolutely ghastly pile of tosh" and claimed that he only took the role because he had never been to India before.

4784.name: Croc
4784.storyline: Michael Madsen gets top billing despite being on screen for less than one third of the movie.

4785.name: The Burning Moon
4785.storyline: Olaf Ittenbach did all the stunts in this film because he didn't have enough money in the low budget to pay a professional stuntman to perform the stunts. Reportedly, he hit his testicles several time during filming.

4786.name: Outcast
4786.storyline: The book Mary gives Fergal for his birthday is "Titus Alone", the concluding volume in the 'Gormenghast' trilogy by Mervyn Peake. In the book, Titus, the heir to the castle of Gormenghast, decides voluntarily to cut himself off from his ancestral home and not to claim his heritage; rather like the choice which Mary is expecting Fergal to make in the film.

4787.name: Here Comes the Devil
4787.storyline: The credits include a page of Spiritual Help ("Ayuda Espiritual") which lists: Nicolas Roeg, Henry James, Neither the Sea Nor the Sand (1972), director Sergio Martino, Spanish director Eloy de la Iglesia, The Centerfold Girls (1974), David Cronenberg, Donald Cammell, Picnic at Hanging Rock (1975), The Entity (1982), singing group Los Iniciados, horror writer T.E.D. Klein, writer/director Sebastián De Caro, Dust Devil (1992), William Finley, Marilyn Burns and classic rock station KGB San Diego.

4789.name: The Alien Factor
4789.storyline: The sequence with the man on the motorcycle was added to the movie after principal shooting had wrapped in order to pad out the running time to a reasonable feature length.

4790.name: Fear City: A Family-Style Comedy
4790.storyline:
Nous tenons également à remercier très vivement Tcheky Karyo, Jean-Pierre
Bacri, Daniel Gélin, Eddy Mitchell qui ont eu l'amabilité de se faire tuer
pour nous
(We are also very grateful to Tcheky Karyo, Jean-Pierre Bacri, Daniel Gélin,
Eddy Mitchell for having been kind enough to be killed for us)

4791.name: Shark Side of the Moon
4791.storyline: Referenced in The Worst Movies of All Time: Piranha Sharks (2023)

4792.name: Ship of the Damned
4792.storyline: When the Michael and Elena are sitting in the brig of the ship, you can see that the chains are attached to the wall on a metal plate with Phillips head screws. They weren't around during the time when the ship was made.

4794.name: I.C.U.
4794.storyline: This was the first time Margot Robbie was bound and gagged in a movie. She later appeared this way again in Focus (2015), The Legend of Tarzan (2016) and Suicide Squad (2016).

4795.name: The House on Laura Anne Dr.
4795.storyline:
Wow this utterly horrendous nothing happened in it!! Bad acting bad script she goes to bed and wakes up every day with her hair & makeup done same as when she gets out the shower honestly don't bother wasting your time watching this utter utter rubbish. I've wasted like an hour watching it waiting for anything to happen like scary or spooky she only goes out the house once to go to the chemist honestly it's just so bad oh and they have a ring door bell but never check it when it keeps going off
So I've wasted my time so you don't have to yours
Utter garbage and I mean garbage it's just bad bad.

4796.name: The Diabolical
4796.storyline: Patrick Fischler and Mark Steger both worked together previously on The Pact (2012) & II (2014). Fischler only appearing in The Pact II (2014).

4797.name: The Odds
4797.storyline: First day of filming was the lake scene on 2/5/17. Needless to say, the water was freezing cold, but Abbi Butler (The Player) endured the temperatures as only a true pro could.

4799.name: #Horror
4799.storyline: Director Tara Subkoff conceived the film when she asked a friend's daughter what her idea of horror was. The daughters answer was cyber-bullying.

4800.name: Zombi Child
4800.storyline: The demon in this movie, Baron Samedi, is the same demon summoned in 1974's zombie film, Sugar Hill. Respectively, the clothing and characteristics of Samedi and the requirements and warnings concerning his summoning are also similar, reflecting his description in Haitian folklore.

4801.name: A Stranger Is Watching
4801.storyline: In the roughly 40 years since this film was made, it remains the only motion picture or television production of Shawn von Schreiber.

4803.name: Strange Behavior
4803.storyline: The mask that the killer wears in the film is of wrestler/B-actor/(Edward D. Wood Jr.-regular) Tor Johnson.

4805.name: Wake Wood
4805.storyline: Wake Wood was the first theatrical release from genre production company Hammer Films in thirty years.

4806.name: Murder at the Murder Mystery Party
4806.storyline: Tubi original movies seem to be pretty good. This is the second one I have watched and I found myself really enjoying it. It's an engaging thriller that took a couple of twists I didn't expect. The cast and the acting was great as were the production values. While the story was a little unbelievable at times, it was still enjoyable with a pretty good ending that brought tension to it. I hope Tubi keep doing movies like this with solid stories and good acting. One thing I did like though was even though there were a few interesting kills, the gore was kept to a minimum, the story concentrated on the mystery rather than the violence. This is a movie for people that like a entertaining mystery.

4807.name: Initiation
4807.storyline: John Berardo came up with the initial reflective design of the mask so the killer's victims could see a reflection of themselves before they die. Brian Frager's uncle, Stan Dufek, a former Disney Imagineer, took the design and created the final mask.

4808.name: Modern Vampires
4808.storyline: Casper Van Dien did the bulk of his own stunts.

4809.name: Paradise Z
4809.storyline: The director originally planned to shoot in a multi story hotel. The original drafts of the screenplay were based on this premise, with major scenes taking place in elevators, stairways, an underground garage, an indoor bar, and an outdoor pool. However, at the last minute the hotel location was lost. The screenplay then had to be adjusted to fit the new location, a one story resort where most of the movie takes place.

4810.name: The Influence
4810.storyline: In the original 1988 novel by Ramsey Campbell, Victoria is the aunt of the two adult sisters, not the mother.

4811.name: The Aftermath
4811.storyline: Originally shot in 1978, but Steve Barkett wasn't happy with this version and decided to re-shoot most of the footage with different actors.

4812.name: The Appointment
4812.storyline: The original film elements are considered lost. The best surviving element is an analog one-inch broadcast tape held in the Sony Pictures archive made for television broadcast.

4813.name: 13 Fanboy
4813.storyline: Several actors in this movie appeared in the Friday the 13th horror films. Director Deborah Voorhees also appeared in Friday the 13th 5: The New Beginning (1985).

4814.name: The Premature Burial
4814.storyline: Roger Corman started this film outside of American International Pictures. Since Vincent Price had been signed to an exclusive contract with AIP, Corman chose Ray Milland for the lead role. American International would acquire the production just as principal photography began.

4816.name: Tokyo Fist
4816.storyline: [Tsuda has just been beaten nearly to death] Tsuda: At least I don't have any problems staying awake anymore.

4818.name: Dark Moon Rising
4818.storyline: Horror icon Dee Wallace worked on the script to this film with writer/director Dana Mennie for over a year. After casting her in the role of Sam, Mennie replaced Wallace with Maria Conchita Alonso in the eleventh hour.

4819.name: The House That Would Not Die
4819.storyline: The German poster features an image of Jessica Harper from Suspiria (1977).

4820.name: Mind Ripper
4820.storyline: First movie to be shot in Bulgaria in the aftermath of the previous government's collapse.

4821.name: Sadako vs. Kayako
4821.storyline: The project started out as an April Fool's gag, but became a reality due to strong fan interest.

4823.name: OutPost 11
4823.storyline: The first scene with Lord Hall was added in post.

4824.name: Invasive
4824.storyline: Filmed on location in Cape Town, South Africa

4825.name: Attack on Titan: Crimson Bow and Arrow
4825.storyline: Edited from Attack on Titan: To You, in 2000 Years: The Fall of Shiganshina, Part 1 (2013)

4826.name: Night of the Animated Dead
4826.storyline: When Ben talks about Beekman's diner this is the first time you get to actually see what happened in front of that diner.

4827.name: Gags the Clown
4827.storyline: A news reporter is named Rebecca Chambers, a reference to a character from the Resident Evil video games.

4828.name: Minutes to Midnight
4828.storyline: Winner of the People's Telly Silver Award.

4829.name: Sorority Party Massacre
4829.storyline: The scene with Detective Watts beating up the guy on the street was shot without a permit.

4830.name: The Borrower
4830.storyline: Originally produced by Atlantic Entertainment Group for a 1988 release, the distributor's closing led the film to spend three years on the shelf before finally being released by Cannon in 1991.

4831.name: Unnatural
4831.storyline: Sherilyn Fenn and Ray Wise both previously starred together in the TV series "Twin Peaks".

4832.name: Zombie Island Massacre
4832.storyline: Actress Denise Texeira was featured on the original poster art but did not appear in the film.

4833.name: Albert Fish: In Sin He Found Salvation
4833.storyline: Referenced in Sparzanza: Inside the Madness (2011)

4834.name: Captive Women 4
4834.storyline: When Elsa first arrives at the train station in her black SS uniform she is wearing the rank of Standartenfuhrer (Colonel, one oak leaf) which is correct for her character. When the train leaves the station and she is standing on the train looking out she is wearing a black SS uniform with the rank of Gruppenfuhrer (Lt. General, three oak leaves); this was a costuming error.

4835.name: Deathcember
4835.storyline: There are actually 26 segments total. 24 before the credits, 1 during the credits and 1 after the credits.

4837.name: The Revenant
4837.storyline: Joey runs into a liquor store called Samsa's in order to help Bart. Gregor Samsa is the name of the main character in Franz Kafka's novella Metamorphosis; he awakes one morning to find that he has transformed into a monstrous creature and is subsequently forced to reassess his life.

4838.name: Harpoon
4838.storyline: The interiors were shot in Calgary, Alberta in the middle of winter with below-freezing temperatures. The exteriors were shot in San Pedro, Belize.

4839.name: Tetsuo II: Body Hammer
4839.storyline: Banned altogether in Germany due to its high impact violence throughout.

4840.name: Blood Star
4840.storyline: Lush cinematography and fantastic performances underpin this beautifully put together indie thriller. The tension builds throughout the film and there are some proper jump scares! Great Baddies, a tough leading lady and a cracking soundtrack make for a slick pulse racing roller coaster through the Californian dessert. The cinematography is off the charts stunning and makes this flick really easy on the eyes of not the nervous system! Shades of "The Hills Have Eyes" in terms of feel but this movie stands in no shadows. Amazingly shot in 10 days on a very modest budget Blood Star punches way above its weight. Highly recommended officer... I mean Sheriff!!!

4841.name: We're Wolves
4841.storyline: Originally thought to be titled: "What We Do in the Moonlight"

4842.name: The Advocate's Devil
4842.storyline:
I liked this movie, I usually hate legal drama crap but this one was pretty good. Sadly, in real life pro athletes get off for stuff like this all the time no matter how many times they are accused, and their fans will always be on their side. The guy in this movie was a complete sociopath, it was really scary! I recommend this movie to anyone who likes legal films, and also to any Lifetime movie buff. The only problems I had with the movie: 1) The movie never tells what happened with that girl who got killed  2) Why did the daughter just forgive this woman for having an affair with her father, and why would she suggest they move in together? I mean come on no decent person would suggest a couple move in together!
Other then that the movie is really good! Please watch it!

4843.name: Goddess of Love
4843.storyline:
(~00:29) Brian, the photographer, wants to take multiple shots of Venus and we hear the sound of the
shutter opening and closing, still Brian, presses quickly the shutter-release button multiple times, instead of one steady press.

4844.name: Cabin Girl
4844.storyline: Mechanic Kellen said he was impressed Ava had driven 200 hundred miles with a busted radiator and a busted headlight. The VW bus is air-cooled and has no radiator.

4845.name: Don't Look Back
4845.storyline: Jeremy Holm (Detective Boyd) was a frequent actor on What Would You Do? (2009), a hidden camera show where staged scenarios are acted out in public in order to see who steps in to help. This is uncannily similar to the plot/theme of this movie.

4846.name: Double Face
4846.storyline: Though not an adaption of original material by Edgar Wallace, this film was advertised in Germany as part of the famous Edgar Wallace Series. It was such a huge flop that the producers at Rialto Film decided to delay any future plans to do further Wallace films. Due to the great success of Dario Argento's The Bird with the Crystal Plumage (1970), which was advertised as an adaption of a story by Wallace's son Bryan Edgar Wallace, Rialto's series re-started in 1971.

4847.name: Atrabilious
4847.storyline: William Atticus Parker's sister, Ash Parker, wrote, recorded, mixed, and performed all the vocals & instrumentals while only sixteen years old.

4848.name: The Cellar
4848.storyline: Kevin Tenney took over as director after the previous director, John Woodward, left early in the production of this film.

4849.name: Don Dukun
4849.storyline: Astro Shaw logo features Red mist.

4850.name: Love Me Deadly
4850.storyline: Many of the guests at the party were played by crew members. Buck Edwards, who plays the cult member with a shaved head, is briefly visible as a guest in the background.

4851.name: Shredder
4851.storyline: The film had a limited theatrical release in the Pacific Northwest of the USA.

4852.name: Carnival of Souls
4852.storyline: Candace Hilligoss, star of the original 1962 movie, saw it and hated it. She warned that if anyone ever sees the words "A film by Adam Grossman" in the beginning, they should run for the exit. She also blamed producer Wes Craven for putting his "signature crap" all over it, saying he should be "hung up by his thumbs at Hollywood and Vine for fans to stone, because he so devastated the intent of the original." She also thought it was ridiculous that they kept promoting the fact that star Bobbie Phillips was from Showgirls (1995) because that movie was so awful. Hilligoss said she saw Showgirls but didn't remember which "nude" Phillips was. "I didn't recognize her. Maybe because now she has clothes on."

4853.name: Lord of Wolves
4853.storyline: I did not know what to expect when I sat down to watch this film , I knew it had the title Lord of Wolves but knew little else.I sat at my HD tv and pressed play on my VCR recorder ( i had transcribed it to betamax format since it is prefered method to view the picture )As the opening sequence began I knew I was getting into a quality film , the actors were superb , the setting the music and the ambience all began to absorb the evening.I opened a packet of my new popcorn I had bought earlier in the day. As I munched the film began to unveil its intricate storyline.I was reminded of a Romereo classic film , it beat American warewold in london since this was so much more complicated with better acting.It was riveting .As the credits came up I knew I had watched a classic , one which will be remembered and talked about in the decades to follow. It was classic.

4854.name: She Creature
4854.storyline: We don't see this until the ship runs aground at the mer-people's breeding ground, but her name, painted on a wooden plaque, is "Marie Celeste".

4855.name: J.D.'s Revenge
4855.storyline: Ghostface Killah sampled the "That was the best fuckin I ever had/That's because you been dealin with Dasheese/You gotta leave? Where you goin sugar?/I got business to take care of" dialogue for the song "Wildflower" on his 1996 album "Ironman".

4856.name: Lion-Girl
4856.storyline: The name of the beasts, "ANOROC", is "corona" spelled backwards.

4857.name: Don't Sleep
4857.storyline: Final film appearance of Alex Rocco.

4858.name: Darling
4858.storyline: After watching 1960s horror films while writing, Director Mickey Keating said it felt "right and necessary" to shoot in black and white.

4859.name: Maniac
4859.storyline: The film was on Hammer's 1960 schedule but for unclear reasons it was shelved. It would have starred Peter Cushing and George Sanders.

4860.name: Enter the Devil
4860.storyline: Allegedly based on a true story.

4861.name: Sex Files: Alien Erotica II
4861.storyline: The fungus powder can only make the opposite sex attracted to each other through second hand exposure. However, as seen with the girl on girl scene in the locker room, if two of the same gender inhale the powder, they go for the first living body they see.

4862.name: The Spider Woman
4862.storyline: At one point Holmes says to Watson, "If you ever see me getting too sure again, fancying myself more clever than Adrea Spedding, just whisper one word to me: pygmy." This line was inspired by the short story "The Adventure of the Yellow Face," in which Holmes tells Watson, "If it should ever strike you that I am getting a little over-confident in my powers, or giving less pains to a case than it deserves, kindly whisper 'Norbury' in my ear, and I shall be infinitely obliged to you."

4863.name: The Devonsville Terror
4863.storyline: According to Ulli Lommel, he got along very well with Donald Pleasence, saying he was "an angel" to work with.

4864.name: Santo in the Treasure of Dracula
4864.storyline: The original 1969 release of "Santo en El tesoro de Drácula" was black-and-white and featured no nudity. The film was simultaneously shot in colour featuring full frontal nudity for European markets and finally released in Mexico in 2012 as "El vampiro y el sexo".

4865.name: Dominique
4865.storyline: Director Michael Anderson has stated in interviews that this movie was taken out of his hands during editing and tampered with against his wishes. Ron Moody was the chief victim of the cuts made.

4866.name: Jack Goes Home
4866.storyline:
Britt Robertson, Louis Hunter and Thomas Dekker
 (the writer and director) all acted together in the 2011 supernatural drama 'The Secret Circle'.

4867.name: The Assent
4867.storyline: World premiere was at Toronto After Dark Film Festival 2019.

4869.name: Sharkula
4869.storyline: Calling the town Arkham is a nod to Batman and all things Gotham, since that's the name of the asylum where all the villains are kept until their inevitable escapes.

4870.name: Even the Wind Is Afraid
4870.storyline: Lucía: You don't seem very surprised...Diego: Oh, no... How could the poor girl be a ghost? So pretty and with such sad eyes...Lucía: Have you seen her?Diego: Yes... haven't you, ma'am?Lucía: How could I? She's dead!

4871.name: Deadsight
4871.storyline: I very nearly skipped this movie because of the low rating and super cheesy cover art. Glad I didn't! I really don't understand the hate for this movie, it's much better than the rating suggests. Yes it's a bit on the lower budget side, but the production values are pretty good. It's a slow burner and relies more on atmosphere than the usual installments in the genre. There are very few characters - the story is set around a very recently blinded man and a very pregnant lady. The ending was predictable, but if you're a fan of the genre you're likely forgiving of such things. The acting & special effects were fine. It's not the best zombie movie you'll ever see, but it's pretty good. If you're a fan of the genre don't skip this one.

4872.name: The Killing Tree
4872.storyline: The tree says it was "born in the woods," but it's an artificial tree a character took out of box earlier in the film.

4873.name: The Exorcist III: Legion
4873.storyline: During filming, the movie was titled "The Exorcist: 1989".

4875.name: H. P. Lovecraft's the Old Ones
4875.storyline: :) A rollicking ridiculous cosmic horror road riff, this B movie gets an A. Tongue-in-cheek, timeless, pedal to the metal, with lore and gore and creatures galore, this unique daffy adventure put a goofy open smile on my face.It's so enjoyable to see an independent genre concoction that feels like it's being informed by a filmmaker following their bliss.As well as a fun cutloose star vehicle for great American acting treasure Robert Miano who can be in anything from THE BOOK OF DANIEL to FAST & FURIOUS to GIRLS TRIP to DEATH WISH to DONNIE BRASCO and anything in between.Whether you're into Lovecraft or not, whether you've seen THE DEEP ONES or not, whether you consider yourself a fan of horror or not, whether you want to laugh with a movie or at it or near it or whichever preposition you prefer, there's 84 minutes of giddy fun here.

4877.name: Blind Alley
4877.storyline: This little known film came as a bit of a surprise for me. Not knowing what to expect, I had the expectations of the usual Spanish horror fare, but what I got was something a little bit different. Its a very simple film, done in a very stylish way. The soundtrack and camera work was reminiscent of Italian giallo, so fans of this will be pleasantly surprised by what you get. The build up was very good and relies on solid tension and suspense, over character development. It all unfolds in a very satisfactory way that will please most horror fans. Don't go into it expecting something brilliant. Just be prepared to leave your brain at the door and go along on the ride of terror as our main character tries to find a way out of her dilemma.

4878.name: Yeti: Curse of the Snow Demon
4878.storyline: The college that this football team plays for is never mentioned, though you can see from their jackets that they are the "State College Grizzlies".

4879.name: Go Away
4879.storyline: Xander Goldman was selected by Scream! magazine as one of 2021's ten hottest horror newcomers, replacing Kyle Rappaport on this year's list.

4880.name: Mulm
4880.storyline: Mulm/Murk is a psychological horror feature based on the award winning book by Teddy Vork.

4881.name: Bad Things
4881.storyline: When Maddie and Cal subdue Ruthie, they use a shirt tie her hands behind her and force her into a bathroom, when the scene cuts back to Ruthie, she's no longer bound when she bangs on the door.But her hands are only loosely restrained. It's perfectly believable that without Maddie's grip on her arms the shirt that is binding her simply fell off.

4882.name: Monster from Green Hell
4882.storyline: The sequence in which hundreds of African natives attack the safari before being turned back by fire is taken from Stanley and Livingstone (1939). Note that star Jim Davis is costumed very much like Spencer Tracy was in that film. If you look closely, the rifles used in 1939 footage and this movie's spliced-in scenes are different models.

4883.name: Dead of Night
4883.storyline: The film's third segment, "Bobby", was later remade as the second segment of Trilogy of Terror II (1996), another horror anthology film that was directed by Dan Curtis just as this film was and the first film in the series, Trilogy of Terror (1975), had been 22 years earlier (with that first film originally released two years before this one).

4884.name: The Cellar
4884.storyline: 'This film was unique and thought provoking. It stepped outside of the box of conventional films and created a fascinating narrative which left the audience deciding on the motivations of its characters. It created an atmosphere of intentional ambiguity which made it all the more powerful.The characters were well developed and the film was well paced. I liked the casting and the ominous mood that the film created. So many films nowadays stick to a standard formula and you get the sense you have seen it all before but not this film.I think if you are looking for an alternative to main stream cinema this film is for you. It is a different experience that may surprise you. These types of films often do not get the credit they deserve. It was well worth me going out of my comfort zone as I often see traditional mainstream films. I am glad that I decided to watch this film.

4886.name: Kiss Me Quick!
4886.storyline: First American film for cinematographer László Kovács. He came to the U.S. in 1962 but didn't speak much English. Nobody would hire him and he couldn't get into the Union. Producer Harry Novak met him through a friend and hired him for this film. Kovács made a few more films for Novak and then went on to become a huge success, working on several prominent films in his career. Kovács never forgot Novak and was always grateful for his helping get his start.

4887.name: Occult
4887.storyline: Myogasaki, the location of the start of the film, is not a real location.

4888.name: Ratter
4888.storyline: The movie is based on the viral clip "webcam", produced by a german student graduate

4889.name: The Rake
4889.storyline: When the father is in his study working on his case file, one of the pictures he has showing, before the scene changes is a man with long wounds across his back. These wounds were not caused by a rake or self infliction but a shank from prisoner in a prison. The man was a Correctional Officer who as wounded in an uprising.

4890.name: Don't Kill It
4890.storyline: The FBI agent named Evelyn is referred as Evil Lynn. Evil Lynn is a character from He-Man. Dolph Lundgren played He-Man in the live action Masters of the Universe movie.

4891.name: The House Where Evil Dwells
4891.storyline: The visual effects sequences featuring the Japanese ghosts were filmed utilizing an old German camera technique known as "Shauftausen". In a 2011 interview with John Kenneth Muir, director Kevin Connor said of this: "...basically you shoot the scene with one camera through a right-angled mirror. The ghost actors are on a black velvet background so you can control the density of their image as you shoot, ie you fade them in and fade them out and line them up easily with the 'live' actors. It worked very well, and of course you could see the composite dailies next day. Eventually we got this technique down to a fine art. It was important to show the ghosts in this fashion because basically it was an economical and effective process".

4892.name: Dancing Village: The Curse Begins
4892.storyline: This film is the first film from Southeast Asia which is filmed for IMAX.

4894.name: Nightmare Castle
4894.storyline: Director Mario Caiano initially wanted to highlight the gory scenes with red color. The idea was dropped due to budget limitations.

4895.name: The Barn
4895.storyline: The production was plagued with issues and eventually shut down halfway through filming. However, Director Justin M. Seaman convinced the entire cast and crew to come back and finish his lifelong dream project. Almost everyone came back and worked for free, even after some of the actors had moved to New York, because they all believed so strongly in the director's vision.

4896.name: Sweet Kill
4896.storyline: Disappointed by the box-office generated under its original release title "Sweet Kill", Roger Corman had Curtis Hanson shoot additional sex scenes over a period of two days, to spice-up the film, and retitled it and re-released it as The Arousers. It didn't help the film's box-office much.

4897.name: Hunter's Blood
4897.storyline: Billy Bob Thornton's first film project.

4898.name: Symptoms
4898.storyline: Disappeared a few years after release and included in BFI's "most wanted" list of missing feature films in 2008. Negatives mysteriously showed up in 2014.

4899.name: Africa: Blood and Guts
4899.storyline: Three well-known persons appear uncredited: Julius Nyerere, the first president of Tanzania, Richard Gordon Turnbull, the last colonial governor of Tanganyika, and Moise Tshombe, a Congolese politician who returned to Congo to "stop the rebellion" and died three years after this film was made.

4900.name: The Terror Within II
4900.storyline: R. Lee Ermey openly admitted in an interview that the main reason he acted in this film was because he needed the money to pay for his house.

4901.name: Island Fury
4901.storyline: Filming began in 1982 or 1983. However, financial problems shut down production. In October of 1988, other producers found the footage, hired two young actresses to film new footage around the old footage, and that became Island Fury.

4902.name: Black Friday
4902.storyline: Kendall Nicole Yakshe is the youngest person to have been in a Starkid show. Her acting coach, Curt Mega, was also in the show and suggested she audition because they needed someone young for the role of Hannah.

4903.name: Erotic Ghost Story II
4903.storyline: Followed by Erotic Ghost Story III (1992)

4904.name: Blood Sabbath
4904.storyline: Yyala: You are real.Yyala: Do you think I am?David: I want you to be.Yyala: Then I am.

4905.name: The Devil's Wedding Night
4905.storyline: Mark Damon played both Karl and Franz Schiller, but the cast list credits Sergio Pislar as Karl. Pislar was Mark Damon's double.

4906.name: The Legend of Blood Castle
4906.storyline: Espartaco Santoni unsuccessfully pursued a relationship with Ewa Aulin during filming. He later had an affair with Lucia Bosè.

4907.name: Stay Out Stay Alive
4907.storyline: Brie Mattson's character falls, her leg getting pinned under a boulder roughly three feet in diameter, or at most approximately 4,000 pounds regardless of type of rock. The ratchet style car jack used to attempt to dislodge the rock should have easily lifted it without the struggle the two boys displayed, ending with the rock re-pinning her. This should have especially been the case if they opted to use a tire iron or the lever supplied with the jack instead of a piece of wood.

4908.name: The Little Vampire 3D
4908.storyline: Jim Carter (Rookery) and Alice Krige (Freda Sackville-Bagge) reprise their roles from The Little Vampire (2000).

4909.name: Fever Dream
4909.storyline: This is the first Netflix original film from Peru.

4910.name: Scare Campaign
4910.storyline: Emma (Meegan Warner) introduces herself as Jennifer Agutter while playing the part of a nurse during the psychiatric hospital prank. Jennifer Agutter is a British actress who played a nurse and the main love interest to David Naughton in An American Werewolf in London (1981).

4911.name: The Asphyx
4911.storyline: The main credits state that the film's soundtrack was recorded using a 4-channel quadraphonic sound system. Sadly, there appears to be no evidence of it ever being exhibited in this manner.

4912.name: Hide N Seek
4912.storyline: *Hide and Seek* is an engaging Telugu thriller that captivates the audience from start to finish. The screenplay is strong, maintaining a well-balanced pace that effectively builds tension and suspense throughout the film. The story centers on a game of hide and seek, but with much higher stakes than expected, and it introduces unexpected twists that add depth and intrigue to what initially appears to be a straightforward premise.The film excels in creating curiosity, with each twist and turn pulling you deeper into the plot. The suspenseful moments are well-executed, keeping you on the edge of your seat as the story unfolds. Overall, *Hide and Seek* delivers a thrilling experience that's worth watching.

4913.name: St. Agatha
4913.storyline: Most of the crew believed that the basement was haunted. The basement was actually an abandoned old morgue.

4914.name: Road Games
4914.storyline: Went straight to #1 when it debuted on streaming platform Netflix in America and retained the top spot for 3 consecutive days - July 12, 13 & 14, 2016 - before Stranger Things (2016) premiered on July 15 and knocked it to 2nd place.

4915.name: Mutilator 2
4915.storyline: Director Buddy Cooper was a lawyer when he made the original movie, but he'd always wanted to be a filmmaker. He said he read in Variety that 30 percent of all tickets sold at that time were for horror pictures so that's why he decided to make a horror movie. He was planning to make a sequel but the first film lost money due to his refusing to cut enough scenes to earn an R instead of an X. Regardless, he said, "Making 'The Mutilator' was the most fun, most rewarding thing I have ever done," and he's wanted to make another movie ever since. This sequel finally gave him the opportunity.

4916.name: Zombie High
4916.storyline: Virginia Madsen, playing a high-school student, was 26.

4917.name: Magic Cop
4917.storyline: Obvious fire proof suit for Michiko Nishiwaki's character when Uncle Feng sets her on fire in the slow motion shot.

4918.name: Nadja
4918.storyline: Peter Fonda acted in this film for SAG minimum and paid for his own airline ticket to be flown to the East Coast to act in this movie.

4919.name: Shadow of the Hawk
4919.storyline: Jan-Michael Vincent would see this title again when he starred in the television series Airwolf (1984). The pilot, parts 1 and 2, is titled, Shadow of the Hawke (1984).

4920.name: The Apostle
4920.storyline: Director Fernando Cortizo chose to have the actors record their dialogue outside of a studio and on location to increase the naturalness.

4922.name: Bloodmoon
4922.storyline: When this film was released theatrically in Australia, it included a William Castle-like "Fright Break", a short intermission which gave audiences a chance to walk a yellow line to the cinema's exit if the film was too frightening for them, giving those who took the so-called "Chicken Walk" to the exits their money back. The "Fright Break" sequence is included on the Australian video release.

4923.name: Frankenstein's Castle of Freaks
4923.storyline: Actor Salvatore Baccaro plays the character Ook, but is credited as Boris Lugosi.

4924.name: Penny Dreadful
4924.storyline: Plagued with horrible weather, the cast and crew had to work through a sandstorm and several inches of snow in order to finish production.

4925.name: Hellbound
4925.storyline: The last film from The Cannon Group Inc. before going bankrupt.

4926.name: Schlitter
4926.storyline: I have always loved French horror films, because of the lack of budget and the result of this: a total freedom in the making, without a f...producer always looking over your shoulder, or a cool producer, not a Hollywood like one. This one makes no exception to the rule. The young director comes from the short feature business, as so many other horror film makers, and I really hope he will continue in this direction, but this time the long length. The script, acting and directing skills are purely awesome for such a first long length feature for the director. I don't undertsand the bad reviews on the French websites. It's just a shame that this excellent film is not more widely known.

4927.name: Tragic Waste
4927.storyline: During the making of the scene where Finch is sat alone in his living room, drinking and taking drugs, Francis Cruz drunk half a bottle of whiskey in half an hour.

4928.name: Siksa Neraka
4928.storyline: Based on the legendary comic by M. B. Rahimsyah.

4929.name: K-12
4929.storyline: For much of September 2019, following its very brief and limited theatrical run, the movie was free to view on Melanie Martinez's YouTube channel.

4931.name: Trailer Park of Terror
4931.storyline: The gun given to Norma by The Man is an M1 "enforcer" Carbine Pistol.

4932.name: The Single Girls
4932.storyline: This film was made before 'Gator Bait (1973), which also starred the 1970 Playboy Playmate of the Year Claudia Jennings and was also directed by husband/wife team Ferd and Beverly Sebastian, but was released a year later. The three of them became close friends while making the film and Jennings asked them to write a film for her. That is how they ended up making 'Gator Bait.

4933.name: The Castle of the Living Dead
4933.storyline: According to Christopher Lee, during the post-sync stage he had to dub his own voice only with a vague memory of his lines, because a continuity girl had neglected to record the dialogue of the movie on paper.

4934.name: The Crawlers
4934.storyline: Also known as "The Crawlers", "Creepers", "Contamination .7" (original title), "Contamination Point 7", and "Troll III".

4935.name: Stickman
4935.storyline: Delia Lisette Chambers, Mary Ditta and Hayley Law's debut.

4936.name: The Ugly
4936.storyline: Director Scott Reynolds changes things up by making all of the blood in the movie a dark, black color. Author John Kenneth Muir writes in his book, Horror Films of the 1990s, about how this visual cue may suggest that Simon never saw his victims as being human, making it easier for him to kill.

4937.name: Untitled Possession Remake Project
4937.storyline: Project notes, plot, and industry news

4938.name: Mutants of Nature Cove
4938.storyline: Jasmin's SongWritten & Performed by Carpe Oculus

4939.name: Laxmii
4939.storyline: Tusshar Kapoor had originally planned to sign Ajay Devgan for the film. This was back in 2016.

4941.name: Slice
4941.storyline: The area code for Perfect Pizza is 312, placing the location of Ghost Town as downtown Chicago.

4942.name: Komodo
4942.storyline: The film was originally made with the intention of being theatrically released on a worldwide level, but the distributors fell through at the last minute. Komodo did end up playing theatrically in Australia, as well as in very limited screenings in the United States and Toronto, Canada, but otherwise went direct-to-VHS.

4943.name: Birdboy: The Forgotten Children
4943.storyline: Despite to be a major character, Birdboy never talks.

4944.name: Rasputin: The Mad Monk
4944.storyline: Filmed back-to-back with "Dracula: Prince of Darkness (1966)," using many of the same cast members and sets.

4945.name: Curse of the Weredeer
4945.storyline: Curse of the Weredeer was never meant to be a feature. It was only ever meant to be a trailer shot during the pandemic.

4946.name: The Naked Witch
4946.storyline: The film was shot in 1960 and has a copyright date of 1961 but was not released until 1964.

4947.name: Skinner
4947.storyline: Ted Raimi researched his role as Dennis Skinner so he could make the distinction between a psychopath and a sociopath. Raimi played Skinner as a psychopath.

4949.name: Django Kill... If You Live, Shoot!
4949.storyline: According to the actors and director, the producers decided to release the movie in countries outside Italy as "Django, Kill!" as a way to take advantage of the success of a prior release, Django (1966) starring Franco Nero. In reality, "Django" had nothing to do with "Se sei Vivo Spara."

4950.name: Cthulhu
4950.storyline: In the scene at the dock, watchful viewers will notice the stern of the U.S. Coast Guard Cutter 'Alert' as the camera pans toward Russ and Zadok. The Alert just happened to be docked where the scene was shot, and the cinematographer lined up the shot so the name of the boat was visible, but no one noticed until editing that the name of the cutter was the same as the ship in H.P. Lovecraft's story 'The Call of Cthulhu'.

4951.name: Blood Suckers
4951.storyline: The two tabs of LSD that 'Francoise Pascal' takes in the orgy sequence were really two aspirins.

4952.name: Candlewood
4952.storyline: Composer of Candlewood is Andrew Scott Bell, same composer from Winnie the Pooh: Blood & Honey.

4953.name: The Night
4953.storyline: The first American film which resales in Iran after Iranian revolution.

4954.name: Dying Breed
4954.storyline: During the first seconds of the end credits just 1 or 2 frames show what Pieman's Pie really is made of.

4955.name: The Hound of the Baskervilles
4955.storyline: Final English language cinema movie of actor-comedian Terry-Thomas.

4956.name: Olivia
4956.storyline: Ulli Lommel and Suzanna Love found London Bridge in Arizona while preparing for Boogeyman II (1983). Lommel started writing a story that would involve London Bridge in London and Arizona's London Bridge.

4957.name: Full Moon High
4957.storyline: The werewolf make-up special effects were done by Steve Neill who had been a protégé of Rick Baker who did the make-up on the same 1981 year's An American Werewolf in London (1981).

4958.name: Johnny Frank Garrett's Last Word
4958.storyline: Based on the documentary "The Last Word" by Jesse Quackenbush.

4959.name: The Ghost Station
4959.storyline: I had never heard about this 2022 South Korean horror mystery titled "Ogsuyeog Gwisin" (aka "The Ghost Station") prior to getting the chance to sit down and watch it here in 2023. And with my love of both the Asian cinema and horror cinema, of course it was a given that I had to watch this movie from director Yong-Ki Jeong.However, my expectations and thrills for a possibly interesting horror movie were shot down not far into the movie. Writers Yong-ki Jeong and Soyoung Lee managed to put together a rather confusing heap of a dumpsterfire disguised as a horror movie. Yeah, the movie made very little sense and it was quite a struggle to sit through it. In fact, I gave up on the ordeal with just 30 minutes left to watch. But I have to admit that by then I was ready to claw my eyes out."Ogsuyeog Gwisin" was a swing and a miss, and for a South Korean horror movie it was sort of a farce. I assume because it was based on some Japanese material from Kôji Shiraishi and Hiroshi Takahashi, and the translation between the two cultures didn't really pan out all that well.I wasn't familiar with the cast ensemble in "Ogsuyeog Gwisin", but I have to admit that my interest in the narrative was so vague and gradually dissipating more and more with each passing minute the narrative trotted on. So I wasn't really impressed with what I saw, but I suppose that the acting performances were adequate, because none of them stood out as being amateurish or bad actually.There were a couple of attempts at cheap jumpscares throughout the course of the 80 minutes that the ordeal lasted for. Not successful jumpscared, mind you, but at least director Yong-Ki Jeong tried.If you enjoy South Korean horror movies, you might want to consider giving "Ogsuyeog Gwisin" a wide berth. Trust me, it is not worth the time, money or effort.My rating of "Ogsuyeog Gwisin" lands on a generous three out of ten stars, and that is mostly because of the production value of the movie and the cinematography.

4961.name: The Deep Web: Murdershow
4961.storyline: When the hacker has traced the IP address and is writing down the location address. First he incorrectly writes "316" and in the next shot it has changed to the correct "318"

4962.name: Slay Belles
4962.storyline: Actress and YouTuber Hannah Minx (aka Hannah Wagner) didn't attend the movie's premiere in November 2018 because she had been missing for almost a year. Kristina Klebe said in an interview that the last time she saw Minx was New Years Eve 2017 when Minx stayed at her house.

4963.name: Amityville Horror: The Evil Escapes
4963.storyline: The main house in the film is supposed to be at the top of an ocean bluff, but the house they actually filmed at was simply on top of a hill. The shots showing the house from behind on top of the bluff were actually filmed at a seaside trailer park with a specially-constructed house facade.

4965.name: Home for the Holidays
4965.storyline: Because of its tight shooting schedule and low budget the production couldn't afford to have snow created for the exterior scenes. Instead, it was decided to have rain outside throughout the film for a more moody atmosphere. A fire hose had to be used to create the rain for the outdoor scenes, which is why in some shots the sky is obviously clear even though it's supposed to be raining.

4966.name: Ring of Darkness
4966.storyline: When interviewed on set in 1977, director Pier Carpi angrily denied that his screenplay was inspired by The Exorcist (1973) and pointed out to the interviewer that he merely adapted his own novel "Un ombra nell'ombra" which he claimed to have written in the sixties but which, in fact, was published first in 1974. However, it is assumed that Carpi's original cut of the movie was considered too much unlike "The Exorcist" by the producers who thus ordered extensive re-cutting and re-shoots.

4967.name: The Blue Elephant 2
4967.storyline: The movie made 4 million Egyptian pounds in its first commercial screening and 22 million Egyptian pounds in its weekend opening.

4968.name: Avalanche Sharks
4968.storyline: Said to be an indirect sequel to Sand Sharks.

4969.name: Jurassic City
4969.storyline: The room numbering in the opening sequence reflects George Orwell's novel 1984 and specifically Room 101.

4972.name: Horrors of Malformed Men
4972.storyline: Although this film had built a reputation, it was not available for viewing in the United States for 40-50 years. It finally was released on DVD in the U.S. but some, if not all, did not contained English dubbing or subtitles. Lack of theatrical showings was possibly due to the extensive topless nudity throughout the film. It was reportedly banned outright in many areas.

4973.name: Sharktopus
4973.storyline: In Caribbean legend, there is a half shark-half octopus monster known as the Lusca.

4974.name: Suzzanna: Kliwon Friday Night
4974.storyline: At the opening credit scene, there was a few capture of the original Malam Jumat Kliwon (1986) played by Suzzanna.

4975.name: Frankenstein Must Be Destroyed
4975.storyline: This film marks the return of director Terence Fisher after an extended absence from Hammer productions, as his films were considered too slow and emotional by this point. Fisher has mentioned in multiple interviews (and by his daughter's admittance), that this film was his personal favourite to make, along with Horror of Dracula (1958). After directing this film and The Devil Rides Out (1968), Fisher would once again be out of the picture for a while due to several car accidents. His final Hammer film was Frankenstein and the Monster from Hell (1974).

4976.name: Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Movie
4976.storyline: The makers of Mystery Science Theater 3000 (1988) were so annoyed by their experiences having to work with a major studio on this film that they later parodied the experience on the TV series. In The Incredible Melting Man (1996), the host segments are about Crow's screenplay being purchased by a studio then ruined by the executives (Dr. Forrester and Mother Forrester) as they vainly try to shoot it and screen it for audiences. Series writer and star Mary Jo Pehl would later call the episode an "exercise in healing."

4977.name: Guys at Parties Like It
4977.storyline: An entire scene involving Kyle (Jackson Trent), as well as bits of scattered dialogue, were added after the actor was overheard explaining his own invented backstory for why someone that looks/acts like him would be a part of this specific frat house.

4978.name: Bedeviled
4978.storyline: At one point the app calls out to Alice by saying Alice, Sweet Alice (1976). This was a nod to the horror movie of the same name.

4979.name: Dark Nature
4979.storyline: Filmed in the Canadian Rockies with almost entirely with practical FX and real stunts.

4980.name: Schlock
4980.storyline: John Landis raised the money to make this movie from family and friends. He originally wanted to make an underground porn movie, but abandoned the idea when he found out he would have to work with members of the underworld.

4983.name: The Cannibal Man
4983.storyline: Despite the English title ("The Cannibal Man"), this is not a film about cannibalism. The correct translation of the original Spanish title is "The Week of the Killer".

4984.name: The Facility
4984.storyline: Based on the 2006 TGN1412 medical trial.

4985.name: The Banishing
4985.storyline: A suspension harness is clearly visible behind the character's noose at the start of the movie.

4986.name: Sherlock Holmes and the Secret Weapon
4986.storyline: The set used for Prof. Moriarty's hideout was used as a pub/bar in Sherlock Holmes and the Voice of Terror (1942).

4987.name: Blessed
4987.storyline: The last film of David Hemmings.

4988.name: The House of Clocks
4988.storyline: This film was originally intended for Italian television and shot in spherical widescreen for subsequent sales to foreign theatrical markets. It was then ruled to be too gory even for Italian TV viewing and released straight to video.

4989.name: Mirror Mirror 2: Raven Dance
4989.storyline: Veronica Cartwright could only wear contact lenses in her eyes for thirty minutes at a time for her role as the blind Sister Aja.

4990.name: Psycho Killer
4990.storyline: The project was in development for over a decade, with Andrew Kevin Walker's original script being written as early as 2007.

4991.name: Hand of Death
4991.storyline: The little boy playing by the beach is Butch Patrick, who two years later was cast as Eddie Munster on "The Munsters."

4992.name: The Quiet Family
4992.storyline: The film was loosely remade as The Happiness of the Katakuris (2001) by Takashi Miike.

4994.name: Mother Krampus
4994.storyline:
Perchta or Berchta (English: Bertha), also commonly known as Percht and other variations, was once known as a goddess in Alpine paganism in the Upper German and Austrian regions of the Alps. Her name may mean "the bright one" (Old High German beraht, bereht, from Proto-Germanic *brehtaz) and is probably related to the name Berchtentag, meaning the feast of the Epiphany. Eugen Mogk provides an alternative etymology, attributing the origin of the name Perchta to the Old High German verb pergan, meaning "hidden" or "covered". Perchta is often identified as stemming from the same Germanic goddess as Holda and other female figures of German folklore (see Frija-Frigg). According to Jacob Grimm and Lotte Motz, Perchta is Holda's southern cousin or equivalent, as they both share the role of "guardian of the beasts" and appear during the Twelve Days of Christmas, when they oversee spinning.
Grimm says Perchta or Berchta was known "precisely in those Upper German regions where Holda leaves off, in Swabia, in Alsace, in Switzerland, in Bavaria and Austria."

4996.name: The Surgeon
4996.storyline: At around six and a half minutes Suzie picks up an unlabelled carton of eggs from a shelf in a convenience store, a few minutes later Suzie removes the egg carton from her refrigerator which is now labelled.

4997.name: American Guinea Pig: The Song of Solomon
4997.storyline: Follows American Guinea Pig: Bouquet of Guts and Gore (2014)

4998.name: Detention
4998.storyline: The film is adapted from a video game by the same name created by Red Candle Games, a Taiwanese game developer. The same company has been involved in a political controversy surrounding alleged sacasm targeting Chinese president Xi Jinping in another horror game it created, /Devotion/ ("Huanyuan"). A proof of such allegation is an inconspicuous reference to Winnie the Pooh ("Xiaoxiong Weini"), an unwelcomed nickname for the Chinese leader, in the game, which is concealed in esoteric seal characters.

4999.name: An Erotic Tale of Ms. Dracula
4999.storyline: Sold to..Showtime, eOne (Entertainment One), Full Moon

5000.name: Howling V: The Rebirth
5000.storyline: Despite the fact that this film states "Based on the novels 'The Howling I, II, and III' written by Gary Brandner", this film is in no way based on any of those novels, and is a sequel to the earlier Howling films in name only.

5002.name: Mark of the Vampire
5002.storyline: Throughout the film, Count Mora (Bela Lugosi) has an unexplained bullet wound on his temple. In the original script Mora was supposed to have had an incestuous relationship with his daughter Luna and to have committed suicide. After filming began, however, MGM deleted references to the crime (and any remaining references may have been deleted when 20 minutes of footage was removed after the film's preview). Because director Tod Browning's previous film, Freaks (1932), had been a box-office disaster, he was unable to object to any changes made by the studio.

5003.name: A Feast of Flesh
5003.storyline: The end credit song, Dark Sonnet, was performed by Lorraine a' Malena and written by Neil Gaiman.

5004.name: Disconnected
5004.storyline: This film was shot on weekends.

5006.name: The Ghoul
5006.storyline: The photograph of Dr. Lawrence's wife is a photograph of Peter Cushing's own wife. She died suddenly in 1971 and Cushing mourned for the twenty years he survived her, often commenting that his only real joy in life was contemplating being reunited with her after death.

5007.name: The Diary of Ellen Rimbauer
5007.storyline: The first prequel to a work of 'Stephen King (I)' not written by the author. As a result he had to split the royalties.

5008.name: Footprints on the Moon
5008.storyline: Final film that features of Dhia Cristiani's voice.

5009.name: Raiders of the Lost Shark
5009.storyline: The rolling text which opens the movie begins "This is a true story" and ends "Just messing with you". Take this as a warning.

5010.name: Trinket Box
5010.storyline: Overall, the movie was fair for a weekend in and watching on TV. I would have wanted a refund if I'd gone to the theater. My biggest criticism is the amount of time the scenes, which I'm sure were paramount to the plot and enjoyment, were extremely dark. I thought my TV turned off a few times it was that dark. Outside of the trinket box being passed around there wasn't a real connection made to the beginning. If the theme was nothing more than old racism still exists then they nailed it. Otherwise, this movie disappointingly left a lot on the table for me. I would not recommend it. Someone else said they were left on the edge of their seat. I was too but that was only because I was waiting for it to end so I could find something else to do with my time.

5011.name: The Westing Game
5011.storyline: Watching MeMusic by Lou ForestieriLyrics by Bernie MeisingerPublished by Forestieri Music (BMI)

5012.name: Hangover Square
5012.storyline: In the book "A Heart at Fire's Center: The Life and Music of Bernard Herrmann," director John Brahm said this about the concerto scene: "For a long time, I had been dissatisfied with the photography of music in films. Musicians themselves are uninteresting; it is what they play that should be photographed. I myself could not read a note of music, but when Herrmann came and saw the finished film he could not believe it. I had photographed his music."

5014.name: Junk Head
5014.storyline: Took about seven years to complete. The film's director, writer, and voice actor, Takahide Hori, spent four years making a short version for preview in 2013, and then another three years to complete the long version for theatrical release in 2017.

5015.name: House of the Disappeared
5015.storyline: A Korean-language remake of Venezuelan film The House at the End of Time (2013).

5016.name: Lesson of the Evil
5016.storyline: Actor Hideaki Ito was praised for his role in the Japanese drama Umizaru. When Lesson Of The Evil released, many people in Japan who went to see the movie were surprised and disturbed at the extreme change Hideaki Ito's character was from the previous drama. This is one of the reasons why the movie became so popular during its release.

5017.name: Devil in the Flesh 2
5017.storyline: Jodi Lyn O'keefe would go on to guest star on Charmed (1998) episode Spin City with actress Rose McGowan who played Debbie in Devil in the flesh (1998).

5018.name: The Caregiver
5018.storyline: The story is set in New York, 1989. Days before the falling of the Berlin Wall.

5020.name: Two Witches
5020.storyline: The severed finger prop is complete to the third knuckle, but later in the epilogue when Sarah shows her hand with the missing finger, it has been severed at the second knuckle.

5021.name: Solstice
5021.storyline: Many of the crew members were living in tents because of Hurricane Katrina's devastation of Louisiana shortly before this movie was shot.

5022.name: The Devil's Men
5022.storyline: Donald Pleasence was originally offered the role of Baron Corofax. He only agreed to do the film if he could play Father Roche instead, because he was tired of playing villains.

5023.name: The Strange Color of Your Body's Tears
5023.storyline: The film features fragments of Ennio Morricone's Erotico Mistico from the film Maddalena (1971) and Peppino De Luca's Rito a Los Angeles from the film Dorian Gray (1970). Both songs bear strong resemblance to different parts Iron Butterfly's 17-minute classic In-A-Gadda-Da-Vida, from 1968.

5024.name: Halloween 2
5024.storyline:
In the immediate transition from the previous film's concluding scene, the madness and terror-filled screaming yields wondering figures in the darkness in parted yet conjoined destinies by blood and steel.Michael's endless lives serve him again as he returns from Hell, resurrecting in the back of an ambulance while being transported to the morgue, courtesy of bovine intervention.A remarkable psychological element utilized herein is the oneiric juxtaposition of himself as darkling {PTSD "inner child"}, accompanied by ghostly mother standing together with an æthyreal manifestation of the white horse* she gifted him at the asylum.As well as the killing spree of bullies and deserving obnoxious wastrels, the theme of Michael eliminating all those who leave him continues here. The executions are not without method. Victims are either obstacles, nuisances, or detriments, many times justified.Loomis develops an attitude problem, glomming the talkshow circuit promoting his over-embellished book The Devil's Eyes without consideration for the privacy of those involved, revealing certain personal information without permission, causing Angel Myers {baby sister} much consternation, to the point of heavy drinking with her promiscuous rocker friends. None other than Weird Al makes an appearance as a guest.Despite this exploitation, Loomis remains a crucial personage to gain both an understanding, and nominally controlling factors.One remarkable scene yields a harkening to that evocatively iconic display of primal strength exhibited by THE HULK flipping the car, but Meyers instead. Staged pre-2k, many such Gen X references herein.Some nubile nudity. Interestingly enough, Michael can actually be heard producing atypical guttural sounds from time to time during killings, while he's usually silent, as in silent death.KILL COUNT: 22._____________
* can symbolize innocence and purity, good fortune, or prosperity.

5025.name: Camp 139
5025.storyline: This movie doesn't deserve a review for the disgusting choice to use actual (mercifully brief) footage of concentration camp victims during its 'flashback' scene giving the backstory to its killer.If that isn't enough for you to decide to not support these 'filmmakers' then perhaps the fact that there is little plot, horrible acting, and barely any gore may persuade you to not waste your time.The first 20 minutes are time filler while our main group is introduced then goes to buy drugs, run afoul of some rednecks and meet the hokey sheriff. Then they go to the woods and get killed in unspectacular ways before an extremely lame ending and long-winded explanation who the killer is.Filmed in 2013 and seemingly unreleased until showing up on Tubi about a decade later.If they hadn't included footage of actual human suffering passed off as entertainment this film would have gotten a 3/10. As is this should have stayed unreleased. Shame on the filmmakers.

5026.name: Killroy Was Here
5026.storyline: The rights to the film were sold as an NFT in May 2021

5027.name: Air Fryer Slaughter
5027.storyline: At the end of the movie there is a scene of Joel D. and his wife doing one more line followed by a end credit title card for the future of MMH Productions.

5028.name: Depraved
5028.storyline: I saw this at Frightfest and was really entertained by it. it nods to Karloff and Lee etc as well as the novel. it also references the wickedness and venality of american drug companies, capitalism etc. the acting especially the monster is great. it even nods to the novels snowbound ending. it delivers on gore and violence pleasingly. The monster has great pathos as it should.Larry Fessenden's best movie in my estimation

5029.name: Terror in the Wax Museum
5029.storyline: Nicole Shelby receives prominent billing in the opening credits, but is curiously absent during the end credits.

5030.name: The Pearl of Death
5030.storyline: Shooting lasted from April 11-May 1, 1944, released September 22.

5031.name: A Reflection of Fear
5031.storyline: The voice of "Aaron" is provided by Gordon Anderson, who was Sondra Locke's husband at the time, although it was later sensationally revealed that their 51-year marriage had never been consummated.

5032.name: Attack on Titan: Part 2
5032.storyline: Attack on Titan author Hajime Isayama was actually the one who suggested all of the changes that were made to the characters and story, because "When I [Isayama] read the first draft, it still incorporated elements of the source material. But I [Isayama] felt like the creative aspect was missing, so I [Isayama] suggested that it would be better to remove those elements".

5033.name: Phone Bhoot
5033.storyline: The house walls of Siddhant Chaturvedi and Ishaan Khattar are covered with horror film posters of Ram Say Brother and also Raj Kumar Kohli's Jaani Dushman 1979.

5035.name: Frankenfish
5035.storyline: This film was based on the snakehead fish incident in Crofton, Maryland.

5036.name: Three Mirrors Creature's Flashes of Flesh
5036.storyline: This is an almost silent movie. There are no audible dialogues and only original score and sound fx are featured in the soundtrack. Some headings/intertitles are occasionally displayed on screen during the action.

5037.name: Christmas Slasher
5037.storyline: silent nightWritten by Landyn BanxPerformed by Landyn Banx

5041.name: The Hunt for the BTK Killer
5041.storyline: American serial killer Dennis Lynn Rader known as BTK gave himself the abbreviation which stands for "bind, torture, kill".

5042.name: The Ninth
5042.storyline: Seances, book of the dead, ritualistic serial killings and putting everything together.I've watched 10-15 Russian films and for the most part, they have been ok. I've come to enjoy their attention to color and costuming very much and it may be what really keeps me interested in watching more.There is a lot of CGI stuff in these films. Mostly used as backdrops or enhancements, they are quite noticable and the beginning of this film in particular, it was almost too much. After the opening scenes, they weren't so blatantly obvious though.The action scenes could've used a bit more finesse as they looked very choreographed.The story here is decent but it lacks depth and detail. There's enough to keep you engaged but I kept waiting for things to be explained more. I was disappointed that the rituals were not explained but they were still intriguing.My guess is that there may be sequel to this and if so, I liked this enough to want to see what else may happened. So, I thought it was pretty good. If you like period horror/thrillers check it out.

5043.name: Medusa
5043.storyline: First acting credit for Bruna G..

5044.name: Swim
5044.storyline: Tucker reaches the lifeboat and uses the radio to call the dispatcher. When he explains his circumstances then gives up communicating by radio, the dispatcher makes no effort to follow up with him about his circumstances or the fact that the boat's crew went missing.

5045.name: Beneath the Darkness
5045.storyline: Bruce Wilkinson (the writer) first met Director Martin Guigui in Austin, Texas at the Austin Film Featival back in 2005 at a screening of Guigui's Swing (2003). Little did they know they would find themselves filming "Beneath The Darkness" 5 years later right in the Austin area.

5046.name: The Werewolf
5046.storyline: When first released, this movie played as the bottom half of a double bill with Earth vs. the Flying Saucers (1956).

5047.name: Eegah
5047.storyline: Filmed in Bronson Canyon, a cave complex in the hills above Hollywood where Robot Monster (1953) was filmed. Eegah's cavern is Ro-Man's headquarters seen from a different angle.

5049.name: Altered Perceptions
5049.storyline: "Altered Perceptions" writer and Executive Producer Wayne Dees was hired by Jorge Ameer to be the publicist for "California Myth" the first theatrical release of Hollywood Independents in the mid 1990's. "California Myth", directed by Michel Katz (RIP), starred Tyrone Power Jr., John Posey. They lost touch for over 25 years. However, Wayne and Jorge reunited to collaborate on "Altered Perceptions" after Wayne watched Ameer's award winning film "The Family Tree" on Amazon Prime.

5050.name: Troma's War
5050.storyline: Film debut of Joe Fleishaker, Troma's 500 pound action hero. He was originally cast as an extra, but Lloyd Kaufman took a liking to him and gave him a bigger role.

5052.name: Bowery at Midnight
5052.storyline: A 1942 table model television receiver is prominently displayed atop a filing cabinet in Karl Wagner's inner office, but it is only seen in actual operation in one scene, and is an early example of closed-circuit television.

5053.name: Room 6
5053.storyline: Christine Taylor was five months pregnant when she acted in this movie.

5054.name: A Scream in the Streets
5054.storyline: During the car chase, there are three detectives in the pursuing car, and all are wearing dark clothing. However, one stunt clearly shows the car has only a lone stunt driver inside, and wearing a yellow shirt.

5055.name: School's Out Forever
5055.storyline: Based on the first of the Afterblight Chronicles series by Scott K. Andrews from Abaddon publishing.

5057.name: Bloody Mary
5057.storyline: Referenced in Film Junk Podcast: Episode 727: 3 From Hell (2019)

5058.name: Isabelle
5058.storyline: Zoe Belkin's character (Isabelle Pelway) is credited as 'Isabel Pelway' and Shanice Banton's character (Carol Murphy) as 'Carl Murphy'.

5059.name: Scared Stiff
5059.storyline: The previous year Dean Martin and Jerry Lewis had made an uncredited gag appearance in Bing Crosby and Bob Hope's Road to Bali (1952). Hope and Crosby returned the favor with cameos in this film.

5060.name: Return of the Living Dead: Necropolis
5060.storyline: (at around 55 mins) After devouring a security guard's brain, a zombie picks up a phone the guard had been speaking into and says "Send more security guards!" This pays direct homage to the original The Return of the Living Dead (1985), in which a zombie who had been devouring a paramedic picks up the radio in the ambulance and says "Send more paramedics."

5061.name: Project Eerie
5061.storyline: The young girl in the first story is named "Blair". A nod to the Blair Witch Project, which also took place in the woods of Maryland.

5062.name: Whoever Slew Auntie Roo?
5062.storyline: According to director Curtis Harrington, Hugh Griffith was an alcoholic and his wife accompanied him to the set each day to ensure that he did not drink.

5064.name: Gemini
5064.storyline: A full-sized water well set with removable sections was constructed entirely above ground, for filming inside and from the "into" and "upward" perspective angles. It was about 60-70 feet tall.

5066.name: Nightwish
5066.storyline: Special effects makeup was done by the newly formed KNB EFX, Nightwish was their second movie. KNB EFX are responsible for the special effects on The Walking Dead.

5067.name: Rape Zombie: Lust of the Dead 3
5067.storyline: Was shot back-to-back with Rape Zombie: Lust of the Dead 2 (2013), and premièred at the Theatre Shinjuku in Tokyo on a double bill with it.

5068.name: Abducted: The Mary Stauffer Story
5068.storyline: Another title : ABDUCTED: THE MARY STAUFFER STORY

5069.name: Mothman
5069.storyline: Writer Patrick Walsh was unaware the movie was ever released on DVD until it was revealed to him that a friend saw it in a closing video store. Walsh was supposed to receive a DVD of the movie if/when it was released, but he has not received that DVD.

5070.name: The Terror of Hallow's Eve
5070.storyline: The show that teenage Tim watches on TV is Moldy's Madhouse (2006), a previous project by director Todd Tucker.

5071.name: The Nameless
5071.storyline: Based on the British novel "The Nameless" by Ramsey Campbell.

5073.name: The Screaming Woman
5073.storyline: Ray Bradbury originally wrote 'The Screaming Woman' as a radio play, broadcast on November 25, 1948.

5074.name: Sugar Hill
5074.storyline: The zombies in this film more closely resemble the creatures of voodoo legend - i.e., the walking dead who do the bidding of a human master - than the flesh-eating "living dead" popularized by George A. Romero. According to the film, the zombies are the preserved bodies of slaves brought to the United States from Guinea, Africa.

5075.name: Rottweiler
5075.storyline: Alyah (Paulina Gálvez) says that her daughter Esperanza (Ivana Baquero) is her hope in life. Esperanza is the Spanish word for hope.

5076.name: Sick Girl
5076.storyline: No nuns were actually urinated on during the production of this film.

5077.name: The Jurassic Games
5077.storyline: A sequence that was supposed to take place in the snow ultimately wasn't done because the snow machines weren't working.

5078.name: Dead Nude Girls
5078.storyline: The writer/director of Dead Nude Girls has been involved in the creation of Stargate, Supernatural, Riddick & Final Destination but here makes a movie that looks like it was filmed on an iPhone.The plot is simple, we have a guy shot down by girls one too many times so he begins to kidnap girls, torture, rape and murder them. The torture as well may I add is genital and deeply unpleasant.Well, that's it. No I mean literally no storyline just several scenes as I described. No heroine, no fighting back, just back to back scenes of these disgusting acts.I question the mentality of someone who would make this. Torture porn movies as people often refer to them as still have a storyline, characters and a purpose! This is essentially nothing short of snuff.The film has no purpose at all and is one of the most pitiful things I've ever seen.For a man involved in such big projects you'd think he would have a) the money to make something better and b) a handle on Hollywood and what will/won't succeed.Disgusting, vile, travesty to the industry.The Good: NothingThe Bad: EverythingThings I learnt from this film:Never to watch anything else made by Ryan Nicholson

5079.name: Mansion of the Doomed
5079.storyline: This was called Massacre Mansion for the UK VHS release.

5081.name: The Lodger
5081.storyline: Merle Oberon fell in love with the film's cinematographer, Lucien Ballard, and they married the following year. Because of facial scars Oberon sustained in a car accident, Ballard developed a unique light for her that washed out any signs of her blemishes. The device is known to this day as the Obie (not to be confused with the Off-Broadway award).

5082.name: Red Snow
5082.storyline: All of the vampire and gore effects in the film were achieved practically without the use of CGI.

5083.name: Blades
5083.storyline: The shot where the camera quickly zooms in on the couple was actually done in reverse. A camera was attached to a truck and driven in reverse, starting from the couple until they can't be seen anymore.

5085.name: Two Front Teeth
5085.storyline: Featured in Movie Nights: Two Front Teeth (2011)

5086.name: Open Graves
5086.storyline: Filmed in October and November 2006, but not released until September 2009.

5087.name: Behemoth
5087.storyline: Throughout the movie the cars have (fake?) Washington State license plates. However at 1:17:32 the helicopter registration on the fuselage starts with a "C" indicating that it is registered in Canada. The movie is filmed in Canada.

5088.name: Body Puzzle
5088.storyline: The first attempts to implement the project took place in 1989. At that time Jasmine Maimone was cast as Tracy. When Lamberto Bava ready to start shooting Maimone was not interested in returning to acting. Joanna Pacula replaced her.

5090.name: Cut-Throats Nine
5090.storyline: The movie's English poster states: "Due to the violent scenes, no one will be admitted without a terror mask. It is provided for your benefit. Please use it. Available free at the box office."

5091.name: Nanay, tatay
5091.storyline: I am an avid fan of Sine Sindak Horror Film Festival for 4 years now and I always watch it with my friends. It became extra special this year because two Filipino films was part of the line up and Nanay, Tatay was one of them.With curiousity and anticipation, we watched Nanay, Tatay first. I expected less because I have never watched a memorable and impressive Filipino horror movie for the longest time.Let me start by saying that the cinematography was brilliant. The lighting and location really added beauty in this film. Next is the sound effects, it gave me something that either made me scared or made me nervous. The story is unique and it was told effectively. The twist was the best for me.To cap it off, the acting was really convincing. The ensemble really played a great part in making this movie a hit (no wonder the movie play date got extended even after the film festival schedule). Big kudos to Andrea del Rosario and Jeffrey Hidalgo (Nanay, Tatay respectively) for conveying emotions that this film required, but the spotlight goes to Elia Ilano who played Malena.
